  • Jeremiah 52
1 Hear ye the word which the Domina speaketh unto you, O house of Israel; 2 thus saith the Domina: Learn not the way of the nations, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the nations are dismayed at them. 3 For the customs of the peoples are vanity; for it is but a tree which one cutteth out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman with the axe. 4 They deck it with silver and with gold, they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not. 5 They are like a pillar in a garden of cucumbers, and speak not; they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them, for they cannot do evil, neither is it in them to do good.

 6 There is none like unto Thee, O Domina; Thou art great, and Thy name is great in might. 7 Who would not fear Thee, O queen of the nations? For it befitteth Thee; forasmuch as among all the wise women of the nations, and in all their royalty, there is none like unto Thee. 8 But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the vanities by which they are instructed are but a stock; 9 Silver beaten into plates which is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the craftswoman and of the hands of the goldsmith; blue and purple is their clothing; they are all the work of skilful women. 10 But the Domina God is the true God, She is the living God, and the everlasting Queen; at Her wrath the earth trembleth, and the nations are not able to abide Her indignation.

 11 Thus shall ye say unto them: 'The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, these shall perish from the earth, and from under the heavens.'   12 She that hath made the earth by Her power, that hath established the world by Her wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by Her understanding;
13 At the sound of Her giving a multitude of waters in the heavens, when She causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; when She maketh lightnings with the rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of Her treasuries; 14 Every woman is proved to be brutish, without knowledge, every goldsmith is put to shame by the graven image, her molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them. 15 They are vanity, a work of delusion; in the time of their visitation they shall perish. 16 Not like these is the portion of Jacoba; for She is the former of all things, and Israel is the tribe of Her inheritance; the Domina of hosts is Her name.   17 Gather up thy wares from the ground, O thou that abidest in the siege.   18 For thus saith the Domina: Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this time, and will distress them, that they may feel it.   19 Woe is me for my hurt! My wound is grievous; but I said: 'This is but a sickness, and I must bear it.' 20 My tent is spoiled, and all my cords are broken; my children are gone forth of me, and they are not; there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains. 21 For the shepherds are become brutish, and have not inquired of the Domina; therefore they have not prospered, and all their flocks are scattered.

 22 Hark! a report, behold, it cometh, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, a dwelling-place of jackals.   23 O Domina, I know that woman's way is not her own; it is not in woman to direct her steps as she walketh. 24 O Domina, correct me, but in measure; not in Thine anger, lest Thou diminish me.
